symptoms: CNC router stalls mid-job without alarms and resumes after reboot.

root_cause_hypotheses.hypothesis: Controller overheating due to failed cooling fan
root_cause_hypotheses.evidence: Operators mention noisy fan and humidity, typical for fan failure.
Reboot clears issue; lack of logs prevents confirmation.

root_cause_hypotheses.hypothesis: Line voltage sag during heavy cuts
root_cause_hypotheses.evidence: Shared circuits in workshop could drop voltage; needs measurement.

most_likely_cause: Controller thermal shutdown from degraded cooling fan.

recommended_actions.step: Measure controller enclosure temperature during 30-minute job
Replace or service controller cooling fan and clean vents
recommended_actions.why: Restores airflow and reduces thermal stress.

recommended_actions.step: Install data logging for spindle load and line voltage

safety_notes: Disconnect mains power before servicing control cabinet.
disclaimers: Insufficient logs; implement monitoring to confirm root cause.

confidence.assessment: Hypothesis fits but lacks temperature or voltage data.

customer_readiness_check.short_reason: Monitoring data required before final recommendation.
